runs.comm: on the middle and leg, pushed through midwicket gap for couple for runs.
short in length, just outside off stump, dabbed to third man for a single.
cutting in with bounce, tries to turn it to the on side and is struck high on the pad. Hawk eye suggests it would have clipped the top of the leg stump

lunges across to again whip it through the on side and will pick up a leg bye. It looked he was struck outside off stump, hawk eye reveals he was struck on the line of off stump. Two iffy shots and two lbw shouts.
just outside off stump, run down to third man region
turned to the on side for a single.
short in length, just outside off, tapped to right of backward point for a single
leans forward to push it wide of mid-on for a single
whoa! It was full and around the off stump, Niall lunges out to scoop it using the bottom-hand over mid-on in style.
even fuller, around the off stump, driven to mid-on
short in length, moves in from outside leg stump, pushed towards wide midwicket and Misbah rushes in but can't prevent the single
full again, driven to mid-on
takes a couple of steps down and Aamer fires in a bouncer and Niall O'Brien quickly goes down under
another lifting delivery on the middle and off line, goes for the pull but can't put wood on leather
The short-pitched stuff has worked for Aamer. The third one in a row and Niall O'Brien top-edged his attempted pull and Aamer himself came under the ball.
length delivery on the off and middle, defended back down the pitch.
short in length, moving in, pushed away to the off side
starts off with a gorgeous cover drive. It was full and in the slot allright but he put it away very well. He moved forward and leaned into the shot very well. No lunging this time!
length delivery angling away from William who punches it neatly through covers for three runs
almost a mix-up. It was tapped close on the off side and Porterfield charged across but his partner wasn't interested and the captain had to get back in a real hurry
walks down the track, moving towards off stump and flicks it past square leg
the slower one outside off, guided down to third man
short in length outside off and the stocky Stirling forces it off the back foot but can't beat point
runs down the track, Razzaq drags back the length and Stirling adjusts to defend
short in length and the Irish captain tries to paddle it away from outside off - hmm risky shot - and will pick up a leg bye for his effort
slower, moving away from Stirling who opens the bat-face to wink it down to third man
moving in off the good length, tries to punch it off the front foot, misses but it bounds away off the pad to short third man region. It would have missed leg stump
leans forward to tap a length delivery on the middle stump to the on side of the pitch and Aamer moves to his right to collect it

Top shot and top fielding by Fawad at deep midwicket region. Stirling shuffled towards off to flick it up and over midwicket. Alam rushed across from deep square leg and threw in a fine dive to pull the ball back from the boundary ropes
banged in short and mistimed pull but it lands safely in the square-leg region
comes down the track but misses the heave but will pick up yet another leg bye
slightly short in length and pulls it away, without much power though, to mid-on
lifting delivery just outside off stump and Stirling arches back to try the upper cut but couldn't connect.
he presses the front foot across outside off and works the length delivery to short fine-leg fielder
m0oves outside leg, Razzaq follows him and its punched to cover
The Jesse Ryder of Ireland is having a ball. Impressive start by him. It was slightly slower and short in length and he swiveled off his front foot to play a thumping pull to midwicket boundary
gets this to skid outside off, cut away to point region
leg break turning past the off stump, gets on the back foot to punch it to backward point
the slider outside off, bottom-edges the cut to short third man
moves outside leg and slashes a leg break from the middle stump to deep backward point region
lovely shot. It skid in from short of length, Stirling went back, stood up tall to play a feisty punchy stroke to deep cover

Afridi takes out the youngster. Stirling, who looked very good in his brief stay, went for the slog sweep but missed it completely. Still, a very promising knock, good for the future of Ireland cricket.
outside off stump, steered to backward point
short of length, cut away to deep backward point
turns in from outside off stump, squeezed to backward square leg
moves outside off, Ajmal cleverly slows up the pace and Porterfield can't connect with his intended wristy flick and is struck on the pad
backs away at the last minute to cut it to right of deep backward point
some over spin on that and it bounces outside off stump, punched away off the back foot, to deep point
slider on the leg stump line, flicked to backward square leg
forced away towards Misbah at sweeper cover for two runs
full and outside off stump, left alone
skids in this time, dabbed towards the vacant midwicket and by the time the man comes in from the deep they hurry for two runs
slow leg break this time, again worked past midwicket for couple of runs. Good sensible cricket this.
quicker, flatter and skidding on from short of length but slips down leg side
gets the line right and the skidder almost squeezes through bat and pad gap towards off stump but he gets the inside edge and the ball bounces past the stumps
comes down the track to drive to long-off
floated full on the middle, turned towards midwicket for a quick single
on the leg stump line, swept away fine .. and Shahzaib pulls the ball back with a sliding effort
flighted on the middle, driven to long-on
classy inside-out extra-cover drive. He chipped down the track, reached the pitch of the ball and drove it past Younis at cover
on the off stump, goes back to punch it away to deep point
goes back to turn it through midwicket for a single
quicker delivery, slipping towards the pad and it rolls away for a leg bye
beaten by the one that went with the arm past the outside edge; he was playing for the leg break but it skidded away
punched to extra cover for a single
curves in, drifting towards middle and leg, flicked for a single
quicker delivery moving outside off stump, Porterfield backs away to slash it superbly through backward point region for a boundary
131.5 kmph length delivery on the middle and leg, glanced to fine-leg
length delivery around the off stump, steered to wide third man region
another length delivery, leans forward to push it to cover point
short in length, hit on the up - a very good-looking shot that - to deep point
bangs it in short on the leg stump line, William Porterfield pulls it down to fine leg
moves outside leg stump, Gul fires it full on the off stump line, mistimes the drive to cover
breaks back in, pushed towards cover for a single
backs away to push the delivery to point region
drifts in with bounce, Kevin pushes outside the line and it comes off the inner edge on to the pad and rolls away to short third man
leans forward to drive to wide long-off
shapes to paddle but the ball rolls away to short third man region.
quicker one, slides in with bounce, tries to late cut but the ball rushes past the edge and Akmal collects. Another tight spell from Afridi.
The Irish captain falls. He stretched forward to drive but ended up chipping it to straight to extra cover. Gone! Ajmal strikes.
turns in towards middle, nudged to the on side
tries to flick it but gets a leading edge to cover
moves outside leg stump, Ajmal slows up the pace, tapped to cover
comes down the track, Ajmal pushes it straight and yorks the batsman and the ball rolls off the pad
spins this one down the leg side
moves outside leg stump and then he seems to have lost all intent after that as he limply pushes the ball back to the bowler
rushing through the off stump channel and this one curves away sharply past the outside edge
short in length, moving in the zone outside off, tries to cut it but doesn't connect.
moves outside leg stump but again can't connect with the intended cut shot. The ball bounces over the off stump as it cuts away from the batsman
136.8 kmph bouncer and the batsman is really late on the pull. Perhaps, he was expecting the Gul Yorker.
fullish, not quite the yorker as he followed the batsman who was looking to move outside leg. He tries to flick and it must have brushed the pad en route to Akmal who appeals for a catch
another fine nagging over from Gul. This was well up and squeezed under the bat ,bit of bottom edge, and Akmal dived to his right to stop it from running away to the boundary
slow in the air, around off stump, nudged to Afridi at backward point
dropped by Razzaq running in from long-off. It was sliced high towards him and Razzaq seemed to have it covered but slipped a touch while lunging forward in the end and spilled the ball
Kevin shuffles to the off side and pushes it to cover point for a single
Mooney holes out Razzaq who makes no mistake this time. Mooney went down the track and chipped it straight to long-on
a tad short in length from Ajmal, Kevin 'Brien waited on the back foot before he pulled it high and to the wide midwicket boundary
quicker one, strikes the pad, perhaps just outside off stump, and rolls away to short fine-leg
edges it down to third man region

Not quite the Gul yorker that we have come to known and love, but it will do the trick. The off stump has gone for a jog. It was full in length, it was straight and it went past the attempted big hit over the off-side. Johnston was looking to move outside leg stump but didn't connect.
length delivery on the off stump line, pushed towards deep cover for two runs
the bouncer this time and Akmal gathers as the batsman ducks
on the middle stump line, pushed towards mid-on for a single
fullish, on the off and middle, jabbed away to the off side for a single. No ball, though. Free hit coming up

Here comes the yorker and there goes the off stump. And they run the bye as the ball ricochets towards off side. The batsman had shuffled outside off and saw the projectile hurl across towards him before curving in late to take out the off stump.
reverse sweeps it for a single to short third man region
moves down the track, fired across quick, driven to Fawad at long-off
flighted full on the middle, squeezed towards mid-off

Stumped. It was the top spinner and it bounced past the attempted lofted hit. Kevin O'Brien  had dragged the back foot out of the crease and before he could slide it back in, Akmal had whipped the bails off.
runs down the track and drives it over the bowler
Another stumping by Akmal. Rudi doesn't even refer this upstairs, gives the batsman slow death from square leg. The doosra broke past the airy swing of the bat and Akmal did the rest.

The end is nigh. Gul shoves Ireland towards the end. The Gul Yorker has taken out the off stump. White , looking for the big hit,  didn't have a chance against that. Not quite at the blockhole but it would do the job.
ooh , the yorker on the base of the off stump, West does well to steer it to third man.

And West is run out now. It was pushed towards the off stump and there was confusion between the two batsmen. Yes and then no, from the striker. Too late for West to get back in time. Gul had picked the ball and fired in a direct hit at the non-striker's end
full in length around the off stump, driven to deep cover
stabbed to the on side of the pitch.
Gul slips in the slower one and it's hit really high in the air as he got too much under the ball and it lands safely in deep wide midwicket region
fullish, on the middle and leg stump line, nudged to midwicket for a single. Gul ends another fine spell. What a tournament he is having. He has 12, Ajmal has 11.
pushes it well down the leg side
pushes the full delivery to cover point
moves outside leg, tries to crash the full delivery to the off side but misses it completely. Akmal collects.
length delivery this time, slower in pace,  that cuts past the attempted dab and goes to Akmal
another swing and a miss.
full and moving away from McCallan who edges it to gully
Pakistan win by 39 runs. The last ball, a really full delivery, has been squeezed out to point.
